title: 'Rust' actor speaks out about previous concerns for safety on set
description: The production for "Rust" is now shut down as more details emerge about what the set was like before the fatal shot fired by Alec Baldwin that killed the film's director of photography. CNN's Stephanie Elam has the details.

title: Activist confronted Sen. Joe Manchin outside the White House
description: Activists staged a hunger strike outside of the White House for days to get politicians to act on climate change.

title: Election officials targeted by Trump speak up
description: Officials and aides in secretary of state offices targeted by former President Donald Trump in his attack on last year's election results told CNN about living in constant terror and shared voicemails detailing the threats they have received. CNN's Sara Murray reports.

title: Spanx employees stunned by CEO's gift
description: Spanx founder Sara Blakely was celebrating a billion-dollar deal, when she announced each employee would be getting a first-class travel gift.

title: A moment-by-moment account of what happened, based on a search warrant affidavit and 911 calls
description: • 'Rust' crew reportedly used guns with live ammunition hours before shooting

title: Watch Yosemite Falls surge back to life after massive storm
description: After a prolonged drought, heavy rains in Northern California brought water back to the iconic waterfall in Yosemite National Park.

title: A private collector is returning a Mayan artifact to Guatemala
description: A private collector has returned a Mayan artifact to Guatemala after it was initially slated for auction in 2019.

title: Is the Boeing 787 a dream or a nightmare?
description: Virgin Atlantic founder Richard Branson once said, "If your dreams don't scare you, they are too small."  He wasn't referring to the Boeing 787 Dreamliner that his airline operates, but it easily applies.

title: Details of ancient Olmec site in Mexico revealed by aerial remote-sensing
description: Aerial remote-sensing of a large region of Mexico has revealed hundreds of ancient Mesoamerican ceremonial centers, including a large one at an important site for the ancient Olmec culture that is known for its colossal stone heads.
